articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, David Brunnstrom, Nandita Bose
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi had offered to talk about easingtariffs, buying more U.S. oil, gas and combat aircraft, concessions that may deter a trade war.
articles.title: India's Modi and Trump agree to trade talks to lower tensions

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, David Lawder, Susan Heavey
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he plans to unveil reciprocal tariffs on Thursday afternoon but gave no details about his latest tariff plan, which could take aim at every country that charges duties on U.S. imports.
articles.title: Trump says reciprocal tariffs coming on Thursday

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: The Palestinian militant group Hamas signalled that a crisis threatening to unravel the Gaza ceasefire deal could be avoided despite uncertainty over the number of hostages due to be released on Saturday and disagreements over aid supplies.
articles.title: Hamas says it is willing to move ahead with Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kyiv and its European allies demanded that they be included in any peace negotiations, after U.S. President Donald Trump spoke by phone with Russia's Vladimir Putin and said Ukraine could neither have all of its land back nor join NATO.
articles.title: EU warns against 'dirty deal' on Ukraine after Trump-Putin phone call

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said only Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy could negotiate on behalf of his country with Russia to end the war, warning a "peace that is a capitulation" would be "bad news for everyone", including the U.S., the Financial Times reported on Thursday.
articles.title: Macron says only Ukrainian President Zelenskiy can negotiate peace for his country
USAID disruptions leave oxygen tanks, TB drugs stuck in ships, warehouses

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: The U.S. has approved the extradition of a suspect in the 2008 militant attacks in India's financial capital Mumbai in which over 160 people were killed, President Donald Trump said on Thursday in a press conference with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
articles.title: Trump says US has approved extradition of suspect in 2008 Mumbai attacks

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Stephen Eisenhammer, Laura Gottesdiener
articles.description: President Donald Trump has vowed to destroy Mexican cartels and end the U.S. fentanyl epidemic, but his sweeping freeze on foreign aid has temporarily stopped U.S.-funded anti-narcotics programs in Mexico that for years have been working to curb the flow of the synthetic opioid into the United States.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump’s foreign aid freeze stops anti-fentanyl work in Mexico

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Four people died in a fire in a resort construction site in South Korea's port city of Busan, the News1 news agency reported on Friday.
articles.title: Four dead at resort construction site fire in Busan, South Korea, media says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te will hold a meeting of the National Security Council on Friday to discuss possible new U.S. tariffs as well as broader relations with the United States, two sources familiar with matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Taiwan president to meet senior officials on US tariffs, sources say
